publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5504 Alex Johnstone: One Step Beyond Campaign—That the Parliament congratulates Kay Gilmour of Angus College for instigating the One Step Beyond Campaign which seeks to collect 80,000 pairs of second hand shoes for distribution in Africa and Asia; notes that the campaign also seeks to raise £160,000 to be split between four charities: Cancer Research UK, No More Landmines Trust, Children in Need and Angus College Charitable Trust; wishes the campaign every success, and hopes that its bid succeeds to set a new world record to have the longest line of pairs of shoes ever laid out.
S2M-5504 One Step Beyond Campaign (lodged on 29 January 2007) Mr Brian Monteith*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-5504 Alex Johnstone: One Step Beyond Campaign—That the Parliament congratulates Kay Gilmour of Angus College for instigating the One Step Beyond Campaign which seeks to collect 80,000 pairs of second hand shoes for distribution in Africa and Asia; notes that the campaign also seeks to raise £160,000 to be split between four charities: Cancer Research UK, No More Landmines Trust, Children in Need and Angus College Charitable Trust; wishes the campaign every success, and hopes that its bid succeeds to set a new world record to have the longest line of pairs of shoes ever laid out. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Donald Gorrie
S2M-5504 One Step Beyond Campaign (lodged on 29 January 2007) Dave Petrie*, Margaret Mitchell* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S2M-5504 One Step Beyond Campaign (lodged on 29 January 2007) Jackie Baillie*, Robin Harper*, Chris Ballance*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Bill Aitken*, Murdo Fraser* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5504 One Step Beyond Campaign (lodged on 29 January 2007) Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Frances Curran* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5504 One Step Beyond Campaign (lodged on 29 January 2007) Dr Jean Turner* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S2M-5504 Alex Johnstone: One Step Beyond Campaign—That the Parliament congratulates Kay Gilmour of Angus College for instigating the One Step Beyond Campaign which seeks to collect 80,000 pairs of second hand shoes for distribution in Africa and Asia; notes that the campaign also seeks to raise £160,000 to be split between four charities: Cancer Research UK, No More Landmines Trust, Children in Need and Angus College Charitable Trust; wishes the campaign every success, and hopes that its bid succeeds to set a new world record to have the longest line of pairs of shoes ever laid out. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Donald Gorrie, Dave Petrie, Margaret Mitchell, Jackie Baillie, Robin Harper, Chris Ballance, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Bill Aitken, Murdo Fraser, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Frances Curran, Dr Jean Turner
